summary: On Sunday March 27, 2022 my daughter and I were in my 2017 Ram 1500 Bighorn 5.7 liter Hemi, driving east bound on a major road leading from my neighborhood. We were going about 50 mph when the entire dash board lit up like a Christmas tree, windshield wipers, radio volume going up and down, all sensors going off, and the entire speedometer went black, all of this happened going full speed, oh, and the gear shift knob turned off!!!! I couldn’t control my vehicle at all. All of this happened and then it just went black, no speedometer, no gear shifter, and no steering control!! I want to remind you that I was driving with my child in the truck!! It is now at my local mechanic with the truck completely bricked. No power whatsoever, gear is stuck, and the key fob is stuck in ACC and they cannot get it out. This needs to be investigated asap. If I was in the highway we would have killed ourselves and possibly someone else. I lost all control over my vehicle due to some freak electrical issue Chrysler refuses to fix. Maybe a fat lawsuit will help. If you research the complaints on this vehicle, you will see this is not the first time this has happened. Does someone, or a family, have to die first before you will respond?!! This is on you Chrysler to do the right thing. Recall these trucks ASAP. I swear to you someone is going to die if you do not act now!! I’m a combat veteran who has been in actual combat, and this was one of the most terrifying incidents of my life, mainly because my babygirl was in there with me. For the price I paid for this truck, it should be darn near bulletproof. Sad day when American manufacturers put profit over people.
Two right rear exhaust manifold bolts broke causing a potential exhaust leak into the cabin.

There is a known problem with the 5.7l hemi engines having the exhaust manifold bolts break. This happened to me where the manifold separated from the engine and caused untreated exhaust gases to escape into the engine bay. These gases were then being sucked into the cabin through hvac system due to the close proximity of the cabin air intake vent and the gases escaping in the engine bay and seeping from underneath the hood when at low speed or idling with the hvac system on.

While in gear the throttle has accelerated uncontrollably without a foot on the pedal.  It has happened twice now and both times resulted in significant damage. Applying the brake made no difference they were just overpowered by the motor.  The vehicle is going to be towed to a body shop to get a repair estimate.  Last time the damage was about $14,000.  The vehicle is not safe if you cannot control the speed. They thought last time my foot slipped of the brake  onto the throttle but I said no it had not. I was to busy trying to control the truck to notice if any warning lights went on. However earlier in the day the cruise control would not turn on.

The contact owns 2017 Ram 1500. The contact stated while the vehicle was parked, she flipped the seats and noticed gray powered mildew under both seats.  The contact took the vehicle to local dealer to be diagnosed. The dealer informed that the two air vents on the cab have leakage, and the floorboards were soaked and needed replacement.  The vehicle has not been repaired. The manufacturer was not notified of the failure. The approximate failure mileage was 55,000.

Air ride suspension drops to bump stops when it rains. Causing the truck to have no suspension give that can cause severe damage.  Truck has been at the dealers over this problem multiple times,  they do not know what is causing the system to fail now.  They have replaced the main components and the truck is still sitting on all 4 bump stops unable to drive.

Electronic power steering stopped working while traveling at highway speeds. No warnings, no issues with steering previously.  Manual steering when eps fails is still possibly, but extremely difficult. Vehicle will operate normally after turning off and back on.

While making a left turn at low speed, I suddenly lost power steering, there was no warning message or notice and steering was very hard, I pulled over, shut the vehicle off and restarted, the power steering returned and I resumed my trip.  The second incident, the vehicle was parked in my driveway, I started it up and immediately got a message on the dash that said, Service Power Steering, the power steering was not available, maneuvering was next to impossible.  I have just purchased this vehicle on 2/28/22, used as is, with no warranty and I feel I have purchased a dangerous vehicle with no options available.  This vehicle is a 2017 Ram 1500 Laramie Longhorn Limited with 128,00 miles on it.  I understand there are some issues with the EPS system on several of the Ram 1500 Model years, and there has even been a recall on some models.  I feel it necessary to report this incident as I am afraid to drive the vehicle, which makes this purchase useless, even after researching this vehicles history before buying, I had no way of knowing of the current EPS problems as there are no current recalls for my particular truck.  If there is a problem with the EPS system, at the time of manufacturing, then why haven't the 2017 models been recalled as well.  Also my local dealer cannot effectively make any repairs unless he has a code or the power steering is not available at the time he inspects it, and ironically  it works fine intermittently.
Fuel sensor fails
It’s the oil filter housing it’s made out of plastic and the heat of the engine cause the seals to leak oil mechanic said to upgrade it with an aluminum housing instead
My electronic power steering failed. Makes it next to impossible to steer. Thankfully low speed, so no crash. No warning prior to failure.

2017 Ram Quad cab truck leaking water into cabin ? 3 rd rear brake light gasket replaced and still finding water on front windshield and dash and also under back fold up seat storage compartments filled with water ??? There are numerous complaints re: Ram trucks of different years experiencing same problems why is this not a issue for a recall when this will rot out floor n cause mold on interior carpets and headliners ? My truck has 12,169 miles on it and I feel like it is worthless !!! I didn’t buy a fish tank I purchased a very expensive truck that Ram knows has this problem many many times ?
Power steering becomes inoperable

When the engine was started a ticking sound is heard, this has been happening for approximately 6 months.  The ticking would go away after the engine was run for approximately 10 minutes.  The truck now has 82639 miles on it and the ticking had gotten worse.  I took the truck to the dealer, Dallas Dodge they reported that several of the exhaust bolts/studs have broken (confirmed 6) and the gaskets and the bolts needed to be replaced.  My concern with this issue is with an exhaust leak I am worried that this could allow carbon monoxide into the vehicle.
Chrysler (RAM) truck 2017 3.6 pentstar enjine  3.6L Oil Filter Housing Leak -    vehicle has 50 k miles on it.    vehicle oil has pumped out of the engine due to this faulty oil filter housing.

The contact owns a 2017 Ram 1500. The contact received notification of NHTSA Campaign Number: 19V757000 (Engine and Engine Cooling) however, the part to do the recall repair was unavailable. The contact called the local dealer and it was confirmed that parts were not yet available. The contact was added to the waiting list. The contact stated that the manufacturer had exceeded a reasonable amount of time for the recall repair. The manufacturer was notified however, no further assistance was provided. The contact had not experienced a failure. Parts distribution disconnect.

While traveling on a paved state maintained  road at approximately 45-50 miles per hour, the driver side front tire on my 2017 RAM 1500 exploded.  The condition of the road at the time was clear and there were no foreign objects laying in the lane of travel. Upon the tire exploding, I was immediately pulled left into the opposing lane of traffic. No injuries or crash were reported during this incident, however had my rate of speed been higher, lack of driving skills, or oncoming traffic, the results could have proved to be fatal. After finding a safe location off of the travelled roadway, I replaced the faulty tire with a spare. I observed damage to my inner fender liner as a result of the explosion. The tire has not been inspected by the police, insurance company, or the manufacturer.  No warning lamps or other indicators provided notification of any problems prior to the incident. The faulty tire in question is Identified as a Goodyear Wrangler SR-A, P275/60R20. This tire is an original installation from the vehicle manufacturer and has been in service for 20,300 miles. This particular tire blew out in a straight line fashion across the tread section of the tire from sidewall to the opposite sidewall.   This is the first time that I have ever reported a safety matter, however due to the unique circumstances of the failure of this tire, I feel that this matter should be investigated and this tire removed from service. I have conducted internet searches and found other consumers have experienced the exact same tire failure scenario. I will be replacing all four Gooodyear tires on my RAM truck tomorrow with a completely different manufacturer. The tire can be retained for inspection if necessary, although it will be disposed of if no such request is received.

My truck has been parked at a Dodge Service Center for three days. I've been told the suspension has failed and needs to be replaced. The cost will be approximately $4,000.  I've never been in an accident. I've never used the truck to tow anything. I don't drive off-road. I DO perform regular maintenance before the recommended time/mileage. I use quality products (oils, filters, brakes, etc.).   No 5 year old vehicle should have a failed suspension from regular commuter/family driving.   The suspension has been finicky for over two years mainly occurs in the colder months. My friend owns the same model truck (can provide VIN if needed) and his truck's suspension failed after year one. Luckily, it was still under warranty but took multiple trips to the dealership and much hassle to fully repair/replace his truck's suspension.   Prior to my truck's suspension completely failing rendering it not drivable, there were many times I was driving on the highway alone and sometimes with my family when the truck would drop lower than entry mode with no warning - a huge safety risk to passengers and cars around me. The truck would be moving at highway speeds with essentially no suspension causing it to bounce and wobble within the lane and over the line. My children are now afraid to drive in the truck.   Please hold Ram-Dodge-Chrysler accountable. Please make them do what is right. Please issue a recall for the air suspension. They should fix the air suspension supplying a lifetime warranty OR replace the air suspension with a tradition suspension that won't fail in cold weather. Ram owners have paid a premium for this vehicle. Please fix this safety issue.  (I have included two pictures of my truck at the Dodge Service Center. Not surprisingly, it is parked next to another Ram Rebel with the same suspension issue. Notice the fenders almost touching the wheels particularly in the back. Also on the truck next to mine, notice the tilt to the right and the sinking in the back.)

Goes into a little knock after warm up, continues through driving all day some days worst then ever , weather it be fresh oil or 509 mike's down the rd , to 2000 miles down the rd, I think it's a manufacturer error

loss of electric power steering (EPS) when taking left turns  and trying to straightening the wheel back there no power steering  and this happens at all speeds called Ram dealer two week wait to get it in to look at it.   no warning lamps or messages.  looks like there a recall on 2013-2016 Ram 1500  and 2018 -2020 Ram 1500 for this problem  but not for 2017 ?

The contact owns a 2017 Ram 1500. The contact received a recall notification for NHTSA Campaign Number: 19V757000 (Engine and Engine Cooling) however, the dealer informed the contact that the parts for the recall repair were not yet available. The contact stated that the manufacturer had exceeded a reasonable amount of time for the recall repair. The truck was in my driveway, with ignition off.  I had come home for lunch and was doing some work on the computer when a neighbor saw my truck on fire and alerted me.  We called 911 and I went out to see what was going on.  By then the entire bed area was completely engulfed with flames and it was beginning to spread into the cabin area.  Within 10 minutes the truck was completely engulfed in flames.  AFter the fire was extinguished, the fire department (captain) told me they believed the fire began in the rear passenger side taillight.  That was the "hot spot".  The truck was a total loss.

Since owning my 2017 Dodge Ram I have had issues with the fuel nozzle becoming stuck in the tank this is every single gas station  I have spent nearly 20 to 1 hr trying to get the nozzle out  I have researched in-line and apparently this is an overwhelming issue as other people and in the dodge forum complained about this  Several times the pump does not shut off because the nozzle is still engaged  And when it was able to become dislodged via force gas has spilt everywhere  I even had employees and a fuel truck driver try to get this off   This is a huge safety and mechanical issue and I’m very frustrated my dodge dealer will not assist me because Ethel say it’s not under warranty It is getting stuck due to the angle of the filler tube between years 2015 and 2017 this last time  Was just recent but other times every month  Please help

Saturday, October 23rd at around 11:00 am the airbag system check light came on.  Brought it to my local mechanic who reviewed the code for the warning and it stated Code B0028-13 Ride Side Seat Deployment Squib 1 Circuit Open. Asked him if it could have been hit with one of my kids feet and he stated absolutely no based on where the connections where located under the seat.

The vehicle’s electronic ignition control does not seem to detect the presence of the key flob in order to activate, thus leaving the vehicle inoperable.  This is an intermittent problem.  I contacted my local dealership (Herb Chambers Ram, Millbury, MA.) and a service inspection was conducted.  Though the dealership could not replicate this fault during my visit, they did confirm that an internal Ram service advisory exists pertaining to this ignition problem.  The recommended correction is to replace the ignition module.  The dealership put the part on order.  It has now been four weeks since my visit.  The dealership reports that the part is on back order and without an expected delivery date.  I am also told that the module is a Ram/Mopar specific unit.  As such, only an OEM can be used.  In the meantime, I am unable to drive the vehicle.  Though it may start, I cannot rely upon it restarting.  Since an internal Ram service advisory exists on this issue, it is obviously a documented problem.  The safety issue at hand is that a faulty ignition module leaves the driver/passengers at risk of being stranded should the unit fail.

The contact owns a 2017 Ram 1500. The contact stated that while driving approximately 65 mph a second vehicle crashed into the rear and pushed the vehicle into a guardrail. During the crash, the front end of the vehicle was severely damaged but no air bags were deployed. The driver sustained injuries to the left knee and wrist and back and neck. The vehicle was destroyed and towed away. A police report was taken at the scene. The cause of the failure was not determined. The manufacturer and local dealer were notified of the failure.  The failure mileage was 70,000.

When the truck gets to a half of a tank the fuel light will come on and the gauge drops down past empty as well as a check engine light will come on.  This is getting more frequent and if this happens at a lower fuel amount there is a possibility of the unit running out of fuel and being in traffic or interstate highway.  This could prove to be deadly.
2017 Dodge Ram 1500 with less than 30,000 miles is showing an air bag system warning. Have checked all the components under the seat as well as the fuses. Nothing seems to be faulty or out of place.
Driver side window rattles during the cold weather months. Dealer reviewed the issue multiple times and can not resolve.
WHILE DRIVING ON FWY ENGINE JUST TURN OFF AT 65MPH AND STARTED AGAIN?
Parked the truck and woke up the next morning to the power steering being out.

Purchased Truck 2017.  Truck is less than 5 years old and engine is now at 66,000 miles. Truck purchased from David Dodge, Glenn Mills Pa. Truck oil changes and 57 point inspection completed with no identifying issues reported. Truck has been serviced by Dodge Dealership with 57 point inspection up to and including 2021.  Last service done 7/21 at Mount Airy NC Dodge Dealer.   Ticking noise from engine became more prominent. Searched online to find Dodge 5.7 Hemi's manifold bolts break off. It is a issue for Dodge 5.7 Hemi's. The problem has been a reoccuring issues for Hemi's identified from manufacturing 2009 forward. Dodge Dealership stated warreny ends at 60,000 miles / or 5 years. Dodge Dealers never identified the manifold bolts breakage issue. The tapping noise from the engine during maintenance by the Dodge Dealer service department never identified the possible manifold breakage issue. Awaiting reply
the electric power steering assist has been slowly getting worst causing hard tuning and am worried the steering will fail with family in vehicel and crash.

How was your safety or the safety of others put at risk? - Failed during a rain storm making it impossible to see on the highway. Needed to pull over putting passengers at risk of rear end accident. Tail gate just opens at anytime going up the road. I’ve owned vehicle two weeks and it’s happened three times.

I have had 2 incidences with my 2017 Ram. The 1st time it happened, I was driving with my wife and handicapped 33 year old son in the vehicle, and had made a left hand turn on to a fairly busy street near my home. In the midst of my turn, the "Service Power Steering" warning message came on the instrument cluster AND at that point the power steering locked up and basically I had to drive without it! It is extremely dangerous trying to maneuver, but I was able to make WIDE turns and get a few blocks to my home. When arriving home, I immediately called the dealer we bought the truck from and arranged for it to be towed and serviced. I had gone outside to start the truck several times to see if the warning and steering had rectified itself. By the time the tow truck driver arrived (2 hours later) he had me start the truck and it was completely fine! Within the next few days I began to notice an icon on the instrument cluster every time I started the truck of a red steering wheel with an exclamation mark. Even though the truck was driving fine at that point I decided to call the dealer and bring it in for service. They had it for several days and no "code" could be retrieved and it did not happen while they drove it. Fast forward a month or so(9-5-2021), and I was parked in a friends driveway. When I started the truck it happened again. Knowing I had a ways to travel, I started to turn the engine on and off several times. It went away and was fine and has been once again ever since, but the steering wheel icon upon starting the engine is still there. This defect is very concerning to me because of having to transport a handicapped adult! It is terribly dangerous because of the electronic steering going out. It is very, very hard to maneuver my truck.

I was in a front end collision.  The other vehicle failed to yield right of way and it was a direct hit to the front of my truck.  The other vehicle was a 2007 Toyota vin # jtezu14r270089246.  My truck was spun almost 360 degrees.  I had on my seat belt but the airbag did not deploy.  The accident resulted in my having a fractured sternum.  The vehicle has not bee inspected but is a total loss.

The contact owns a 2017 Dodge Ram 1500. The contact stated that while moving out of a parking space, the steering fault warning light illuminated, and the vehicle lost power steering functionality. The contact had the vehicle towed to the dealer who stated that the vehicle was not included in an unknown recall. The contact was informed that the rack and pinion steering column needed to be replaced. The contact had a certified mechanic repair the vehicle. The contact stated that water leaked into the circuit and caused the failure to reoccur. The contact took the vehicle to a car wash several months later and water leaked into the circuit causing the failure to recur. The manufacturer was made aware of the failure and referred the contact to the NHTSA. The approximate failure mileage was 119,000.

The Electronic Power Steering (EPS) system threw a code for a short circuit and the EPS system failed. I lost my power steering while on the road and was unable to safely operate my RAM. The power steering light indicator was on. This problem was serviced at Apple Chrysler Dodge in Hanover PA on July 21 2021, invoice attached, costing me $2653.43. This is the SAME ISSUE that was addressed for both the 2015 and 2016 RAM 1500s in a recall for “loss of power steering assist”, issued March 23, 2016 (NHTSA No 16V167000).

The fuel sending unit failed on several occasions. The vehicle display would indicate low fuel and the gauge would go to full empty. On the third time it displayed I also got a check ending light. Not knowing if the tank was really empty, I filled and it took 11 gallons for a 26 gallon tank. Dealer indicated code P0463 fuel level sensor failure. Online there are lots of complaints of this happening with less than 50k miles. Why hasn't this become a recall? it is not safe to have sensor fail while driving due to distraction. Not to mention an unnecessary expense for the owner. Ram should have corrected this issue long before the 2017 model year.

3 bolts holding DPF and SCR together are known to fail and cause issues to the DEF wiring harness. All three bolts have failed on my truck which could cause the exhaust to fall apart while driving. The problem has not been reproduced or confirmed by a dealer or independent center. The vehicle has not been inspected by anyone. The "check engine light" displayed and shortly there after a message popped up that vehicle would not restart in 200 miles. Still waiting to hear back from 1 of 4 dealerships about this issue and have since opened a case with FCA/RAM and have not heard from them either. Truck has not been drivable for 4 days now.

The contact owns a 2017 RAM 1500. The contact stated that while reversing and depressing the accelerator pedal, the vehicle went into overdrive and crashed into a building. The contact stated no warning light was illuminated. The air bags did not deploy. The contact stated no one was injured nor sought medical attention. A police report was not reported. The contact did not call the local dealer and made them aware of this failure. On June 21, 2021, the contact stated that when approaching an intersection and depressing the brake pedal, the vehicle went into overdrive again. The contact stated no warning light was illuminated. The contact stated he depressed the brake pedal to the floor to stop the vehicle. The contact took the vehicle to a local dealer, where it was diagnosed with needing the brake and accelerator assembly to be replaced. The vehicle was not repaired. The manufacturer had been informed of the failure. The failure mileage was approximately 26,000.

The contact owns a 2017 Ram 1500. The contact stated while driving 40 mph, the steering wheel became difficult to turn. The contact pulled over and towed the vehicle to his residence. The contact stated that the power steering warning light was illuminated. The vehicle was not diagnosed or repaired. The manufacturer was not informed of the failure. The failure mileage was approximately 65,000.

The contact owns a 2017 Ram 1500. The contact received notification of NHTSA campaign number: 19V757000 (Engine and Engine Cooling) however, the part to do the recall repair was unavailable. The contact called the local dealer and it was confirmed that the part was not available. The contact was added to the waiting list. The contact stated that the manufacturer had exceeded a reasonable amount of time for the recall repair. The manufacturer was not made aware of the issue. The contact had not experienced a failure. A quick internet search shows it is a common problem.   I know many ram owners who have the exhaust manifolds break repeatedly.  Both are  severe problems.

The fuel sending unit failed on several occasions.  The vehicle display would indicate low fuel and the gauge would go to full empty.  On the third time it displayed I also got a check ending light.  Not knowing if the tank was really empty, I filled and it took 11 gallons for a 26 gallon tank.  Dealer indicated code P0463 fuel level sensor circuit high.  With only 25k miles it does not seem reasonable to have this failure.  Online there are lots of complaints of this happening with less than 50k miles.  Why hasn't this become a recall?  it is not safe to have sensor fail while driving due to distraction.  Not to mention an unnecessary expense for the owner. The contact's husband owns a 2017 Ram 1500. The contact stated that while her husband was driving 25 mph, the vehicle stalled. The contact stated he attempted to restart the vehicle and the check engine warning light illuminated. After multiple attempts, the vehicle failed to restart and was towed to the contact's residence. Upon investigation, the contact discovered NHTSA Campaign Number: 20V475000 (Engine and Engine Cooling) which he linked to the failure however, the VIN was not included. The contact was unsuccessful in reaching the dealer. The manufacturer was not notified of the failure. The vehicle was not repaired or diagnosed. The failure mileage was approximately 75,000.

The contact's husband owns a 2017 Ram 1500. The contact stated that while driving at various speeds, the vehicle lost power steering assist and excessive force was needed to steer the vehicle. The contact's husband had taken the vehicle to the dealer however, the mechanic was unable to service the vehicle. The contact then made an appointment with the dealer for the vehicle to be serviced. The manufacturer was not notified of the failure. The vehicle was not repaired. The failure mileage was approximately 50,000

The bolts that hold the exhaust manifold to the engine are breaking leading to a loud "tick" and exhaust gasses being released in the engine compartment. Exhaust leaks can be dangerous while the vehicle is occupied especially when idling. This has been an ongoing issue with the HEMI engine in RAM trucks as evidenced by multiple NHTSA complaints spanning over a decade. Ram has yet to correct the issue and continues to produce vehicles with the same problem. Mechanics talk about it being common, many forums are filled with complaints and websites are dedicated to the issue. My particular truck was inspected by the dealership and I was told it was "a common occurrence with those engines". I'm fine with having to pay the $500 repair bill to correct it, but I feel it should be a recall due to the commonality of the problem and the possibility of a driver or passenger being exposed to exhaust gasses not being properly routed to the rear of the truck. Why are they allowed to keep rolling a known problem off of the assembly line? Maybe this explains headaches after a long drive.

The contact owns a 2017 Ram 1500. The contact stated that while driving approximately 30 mph,  a driver driving a Kia Optima failed to stop causing the contact to crash into the vehicle. The air bags did not deploy. The contact mentioned that there was severe front-end damage to his vehicle. The contact sustained injuries to his shoulder, neck,  and head. The driver was provided medical attention. A police report was filed. There was no reported fire.  The vehicle was towed to an independent mechanic. The local dealer was not contacted. The vehicle was not diagnosed or repaired. The manufacturer was notified of the failure. The failure mileage was 39,000.

Electronic power steering appears to be intermittently inoperative.  I was driving this past weekend and multiple times when turning in parking lot or going under 20 mph or at least that is what I noticed, it became difficult to steer and then forcing steering all the sudden power steering kicks in almost causing accident.  I will be taking my truck into dealership but I see there are no recalls yet on this problem and I see complaints going back many years.  This is truly a safety concern.....

On 7/16/2021 I was driving my truck when with no warning at all it completely shut off and would not restart and would not let me take the key out. I had to call for a tow truck to pull me out of the drive thru I was stuck at and my truck is currently at my mechanics shop. I was fortunate that this incident took place while moving at a slow speed while in a drive thru at a restaurant.  If this had taken place while driving on the freeway or in traffic, I believe I would most likely be dead right now, this was a total shutdown of my truck with absolutely no warning. I called the dealer to advise of the incident and ask if there were any known issues and they were quick to say that only 2018 dodge ram 1500 trucks had this issue and it had to be my battery. Both Triple AAA tow truck driver and mechanic shop that currently has my truck have confirmed that the battery is working perfectly and has no issues. I purchased my truck Oct of 2017 and I am worried that I might have a faulty computer system. Can someone please investigate this incident, I had my 15 yr old son in the truck with me and as I mentioned before if this had happened on the freeway at 75 mph and it completely shut down this same way, we most likely would have been in a major accident and injured and possibly killed. My mechanic spent the entire day trying to find the problem with the truck but is not able to obtain any error codes from the computer. It seems impossible that my truck can completely shut down with no warning, fail to start, fail to be able to remove the key fob from the ignition and yet there is no error showing in the system.

For the second time in about a year my truck has given the error code of "service electronic throttle control." I took it in and was told it was a computer update and it was fixed. Right at about a year later, the same error code appeared. With this error, power to the vehicle is reduced causing safety issues as your ability to maintain speed or accelerate is greatly diminished. I do not know if the part itself was inspected during the original service and computer update. There were no warning lamps or symptoms prior to the error message coming up on the instrument cluster.
Vehicular hesitated to select gear and to accelerate.  This has concerned me when in traffic when you expect it to accelerate   This is an on going issue no

Third brake leaks into the cab under the seat through the sound proofing causing mold in the cab. Vehicle has approximately 29k miles and I would not have notice if I did not lift the seat up where I found some of my items with moldy and wet. If not notice if could cause respiratory issues to occupants. The manufacturer and dealer does not want to cover the repairs. Upon further inquiries, many older models had the same problem. This is a serious health hazard.

The fuel sensor has failed which causes us not to know how much gas is in the vehicle.  The vehicle only has 30,800 miles on it.  There is another issue that we are currently getting checked.  The vehicle would not start even with a jump.  After leaving it on trickle charge we got to to start but the traction control light came on the service shifter light came, and it said there were no pressure in the tires.  We parked the vehicle and had someone come pick us up due to us not feeling safe because it was shifting weird.  We had to have it towed to a dealer and they are currently diagnosing it.

On two occasions within the last three days, while driving and about to make a turn, my power steering was completely disabled. The first time I was turning onto another street and nearly ran into the ditch.  Luckily the second time, I was leaving a parking lot. On both occasions, it was very very difficult to turn the truck with no power steering. Once I turned the truck off for a while to research the problem and restarted it, the problem went away. I am now afraid to drive my truck on a upcoming trip to the mountains.

The contact owns a 2017 Ram 1500. The contact stated while attempting to exceed speeds above 25 mph, the vehicle jerked with the check engine warning light illuminated. The contact stated that speed increased after a moment with a hard jerk with the check engine warning light illuminated. The vehicle was taken to an independent mechanic to be diagnosed. The mechanic located a transmission fault code. The vehicle was taken to a dealer to be diagnosed. The diagnostic report was not provided. The vehicle was not repaired. The manufacturer was not contacted. The failure mileage was 25,000.

I was in a vehicle accident May 28, 2021 in my 2017 Ram 1500 on my way to my sons very important medical appointment in Ann Arbor.  It was raining horribly and the roads were pretty slick.  We were going about 60mph with the rest of traffic due to the visibility.  I was rear ended by a hit and run driver in the left lane which caused my vehicle to hydro plane into the right lane where my vehicle hit a steel guard rail and I was then t-boned by an oncoming vehicle in the right lane.  My vehicle then did a complete 360.  My vehicle was struck twice by two different vehicles and also hit a guardrail, none of my vehicles airbags went off.  I was a back seat passenger and seat belted in.  I. suffered a bad whip lash.  I went to the emergency room a few days later because the pain was unbearable.  My 1 month old son was in the vehicle as well as his father.  Thankfully my son was in a car seat and the seat belts worked and was wearing one, my injuries could have been worse.  Because the air bags did not go off, my car may not be considered as totaled.  When picking up my vehicle from the tow service, there was a newer model Ford F150 same size vehicle and similar damages as my truck, all of that vehicles air bags went off.  Why didnt mine?  I have attached my 2017 Ram 1500 photos as well as the Ford F150 photos to show the similar damages to both vehicles with one vehicles air bags failing to go off and one did not.

Electronic power steering failure while driving at high speeds, rendering the vehicle not able to drive. THE VEHICLE WAS BOUGHT NEW BY ME, AND ONLY USED FOR PERSONAL USE ON PUBLIC ROADS.  THE TRUCK HAS NOT BEEN USED FOR WORK NOR USED IN DIRT ETC.  THE BRAKES AND EVERYTHING ELSE ON THE VEHICLE ARE THE ORIGINAL COMPONENTS THAT CAME WITH THE VEHICLE WHEN NEW.  THE BRAKE PADS ON THE VEHICLE AT ONLY 29,000 MILES ARE "CRUMBLING" (THOSE WERE THE WORDS FROM THE DODGE/RAM DEALERSHIP SERVICE DEPT), AND THE OUTER EDGES OF THE FRONT BRAKE ROTORS ARE FLAKING APART.  THE DEALERSHIP SAID THEY SEE THIS A LOT WITH RAM TRUCKS, AND SOME THAT ARE ONLY A YEAR OLD WITH LOW MILEAGE.  THE DEALER SERVICE DEPT SAID CHRYSLER KNOWS ABOUT THIS, BUT WON'T DO ANYTHING.  THE DEALERSHIP SAID THE BRAKES ARE DANGEROUS AND THE VEHICLES WITH THIS PROBLEM CANNOT BE DRIVEN SAFELY, SO THE BRAKES (PADS AND ROTORS) MUST BE REPLACED.  THE DEALER TOLD ME TO CALL CHRYSLER AT 800-992-1997.  THE CHRYSLER "CUSTOMER CARE" PEOPLE REFUSED TO ACKNOWLEDGE THAT THEY KNOW ABOUT THIS PROBLEM, BUT THEY SAID THAT THEY KNOW THAT THEIR BRAKES DON'T LAST LONG, WHICH IS WHY THEY ONLY PROVIDE A WARRANTY OF 12-MONTHS/12,000 MILES, DESPITE THE ADVERTISED 36-MONTH "BUMPER-TO-BUMPER" WARRANTY.  THIS PROBLEM WITH THE BRAKES IS DUE TO VERY LOW QUALITY MATERIALS, AND IS A MAJOR SAFETY HAZARD FOR ANYONE WITH A RAM TRUCK, AS WELL AS A SAFETY HAZARD TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC WHO COULD BE INJURED BY RAM TRUCKS THAT HAVE THESE BRAKES.  CHRYSLER (RAM) IS KNOWINGLY PUTTING VEHICLES ON THE ROADS WITH UNSAFE BRAKE COMPONENTS.  BRAKES ARE THE MOST IMPORTANT SAFETY ITEMS ON VEHICLES, AND THE BRAKES SHOULD BE MADE OF QUALITY MATERIALS, AND NOT BE FALLING APART AND FAILING SO SOON.  REGARDLESS OF WHETHER BRAKE PADS ARE WEAR ITEMS, THIS IS NOT A WEAR ISSUE.  THOSE BRAKE PADS HAVE A LOT OF THICKNESS, BUT THEY'RE CRUMBLING, WHICH IS PREMATURE FAILURE.  AND THE BRAKE ROTORS SHOULD NOT BE FALLING APART.

RETURNING FROM A TRIP TO MI BACK TO MY RESIDENCE IN TN. AS I MADE A TURN INTO MY SUBDIVISION I STARTED TO ACCELERATE TO MY NEXT TURN WHEN I EXPERIENCED A SUDDEN ACCELERATION OF MY VEHICLE. I HAD BEEN USING THE VEHICLES CRUISE CONTROL AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE DURING THE 10 HOUR DRIVE HOME SO IT FELT FAMILIAR, LIKE THE CRUISE CONTROL WAS TRYING TO ACCELERATE MY VEHICLE. AS THE VEHICLE WAS ACCELERATING AND I WAS STEERING THE THROUGH THE CURVES IN THE ROAD I HAD REMOVED MY FOOT FROM THE GAS PEDAL AND TRIED HITTING THE CRUISE CONTROL OFF BUTTON SEVERAL TIMES. THIS HAD NO EFFECT IN STOPPING OR SLOWING THE ACCELERATION. THE TOTAL DISTANCE FROM MY TURN INTO THE SUBDIVISION TO THE END OF THE ROAD OR NEXT INTERSECTION WAS ROUGHLY 250-300 YARDS ALL DOWNHILL SO WE PICKED UP SPEED QUICKLY. BY THE TIME I REALIZED I COULD NOT EFFECT OR SLOW DOWN THE ACCELERATION BY SHUTTING OFF THE CRUISE CONTROL MY NEXT THOUGHT WAS TO HIT THE BRAKES BUT WE HAD RUN OUT OF ROAD. AT THIS POINT I CHOSE A DIRECTION WHERE I SAW NO HOUSES OR LARGE TREES. WE HIT AN AREA WHERE IT SLOPED UP ABOUT 30 DEGREES THEN FLATTENED OUT THEN SLOPED UP AGAIN COMING CLOSER TO OTHER HOUSES. I'M GUESSING WE WERE TRAVELING ABOUT 50-55 MPH WHEN I WENT OFF THE ROAD. WE FINALLY CAME TO A STOP AFTER HITTING BOTH SLOPES AND THE CLOSEST HOUSES BACK YARD DECK AND THEN INTO A TREE. I HAD MY FAMILY IN THE VEHICLE WITH ME; MY WIFE, TWO SONS AND DAUGHTER. ONE OF MY SONS WAS TAKEN TO THE HOSPITAL VIA AMBULANCE FOR BACK PAIN AND A CUT ABOVE HIS EYE WHICH REQUIRED 8-9 STITCHES. THE REST OF MY FAMILY WERE CHECKED OUT WITH NO INJURIES TO SPEAK OF AT THAT TIME. ONLY AT THE HOSPITAL I LEARNED OF THE RECALL FOR THE CRUISE CONTROL AND AN EXPLANATION OF THE CAUSE AND EFFECT IT HAD. THE RECALL EXPLANATION FIT VERBATIM TO WHAT HAPPENED TO US. WE HAD NOT RECEIVED ANY NOTIFICATION FOR THE RECALL ON THIS VEHICLE OR THE OTHER DODGE VEHICLE WE OWN. *DT  *TR

ON IMPACT, MY DRIVER'S SEAT BROKE CAUSING ME TO LAY FLAT, RIPPING MY GRIP OFF THE STEERING WHEEL  AND THEN GOING INTO ON COMING TRAFFIC WHICH CAUSED ME TO HEAD ON COLLIDE WITH A CHEV. AVALANCHE TOTALING ALL THREE VEHICLES. I INJURED MY NECK, LOWER AND MIDDLE BACK. ALSO, BRUISED MY SHOULDER, RIBS AND UPPER ARM. I HAVE TWO CONCERNS. I BELIEVE THERE SHOULD BE BETTER TESTING OF REAR-END COLLISIONS. I BELIEVE IF MY SEAT WOULD NOT HAVE BROKE, I WOULD HAVE STAYED IN CONTROL OF MY VEHICLE POSSIBLY PREVENTING MY TRUCK GOING INTO ONCOMING TRAFFIC. ALSO, MY BACK AND NECK WOULD NOT HAVE RECEIVED AS MUCH WHIPPING MOTION CAUSING MY INJURIES. MY SECOND CONCERN IS THE AIRBAGS NOT DEPLOYING IN THE HEAD ON COLLISION. THE AVALANCHE'S AIRBAGS DEPLOYED BUT MINE DID NOT. I WROTE CHRYSLER AN EMAIL REPORTING THE INCIDENT AND MY CONCERNS. BOSCH HAS TOLD ME THEY SENT THE INVESTIGATION REPORT TO CHRYSLER TO REVIEW AND THEY WILL RESPOND TO ME WITHIN THE NEXT TWO WEEKS. I BELIEVE MORE STRICTER TESTING SHOULD BE DONE AND SEATS SHOULD BE IMPROVED TO AVOIDED SEATS BREAKING IN COLLISIONS CAUSING INJURY AND DEATH TO FRONT AND REAR PASSENGERS. 2017 RAM 1500 - VEHICLE'S ELECTRONIC CONTROLLED LOCKING TAILGATE FAILS TO SECURE WHEN VEHICLE IS PUT IN MOTION ALLOWING TAILGATE TO FALL OPEN WHILE VEHICLE IS IN MOTION. ALSO POTENTIAL TO OCCUR WHILE VEHICLE IS PARKED.       FIAT-CHRYSLER WAS CONTACTED ON 24 JANUARY 2018 AND AFFIRMED THEY HAVE NO TECHNICAL SERVICE BULLETINS (TSBS) OR RECALLS ON THIS ISSUE TO DATE. HOWEVER, INTERNET RESEARCH REVEALED "NUMEROUS" COMPLAINTS IN FORUMS AND VIDEOS ON THIS OCCURRING ON 2013 - 2017 MODELS. SOME COMPLAINANTS INDICATE DEALERSHIPS NOT AWARE OR UNABLE TO DEDUCE CAUSE. FURTHER INTERNET RESEARCH INDICATES A FAULTY TAILGATE ACTUATOR ASSEMBLY, (A METAL TAB ON ASSEMBLY WHICH SERVES AS A LEVER-STOP WHICH ALLOWS TAILGATE TO SECURE IS BREAKING OFF OF ASSEMBLY PLATE AND PREVENTING FULL ENGAGEMENT OF THE LOCKING MECHANISM BETWEEN TAILGATE AND BED). SOME COMPLAINTS REVIEWED ONLINE INDICATE DEALERS REPLACED LOCKING TAILGATE ACTUATOR ASSEMBLY (IN APPLICABLE CASES, UNDER MFR WARRANTY) AND THE MATTER WAS RESOLVED.    PROBLEM CREATES POTENTIAL FOR LOSING CARGO WHILE IN MOTION, FALLING TAILGATE STRIKING A PERSON, CAUSING STRUCTURAL DAMAGE, OR, BEING SUCH A VOLATILE OCCURRENCE DUE TO WEIGHT OF TAILGATE, ALARMING AN UNSUSPECTING DRIVER DIVERTING ATTENTION, CAUSING PANIC AND POSSIBLE ACCIDENT. FIAT-CHRYSLER CUSTOMER SERVICE REP RECOMMENDED ON 25 JANUARY 2018, THAT I, AS THE CUSTOMER, FILE A COMPLIANT WITH NHTSA.
